chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type

Goal:
(forall a b : A, {a = b} + {a <> b}) -> forall l1 l2 : list A, {permutation l1 l2} + {~ permutation l1 l2}

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive permutation : list A -> list A -> Prop := permutation_nil : permutation [] [] | permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1) | permutation_swap : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), permutation (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l) | permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3 Arguments permutation (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_skip _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_swap _ _ _%list_scope Arguments permutation_trans (_ _ _)%list_scope
Ascii.ascii_dec : forall a b : Ascii.ascii, {a = b} + {a <> b}
permutation_one_inv_aux : forall l1 l2 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> forall a : A, l1 = [a] -> l2 = [a]
permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3
permutation_ind : forall P : list A -> list A -> Prop, P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
permutation_sind : forall P : list A -> list A -> SProp, P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
all_permutations_permutation : forall l1 l2 : list A, In l1 (all_permutations l2) -> permutation l1 l2
permutation_all_permutations : forall l1 l2 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> In l1 (all_permutations l2)
permutation_app_comp : forall l1 l2 l3 l4 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l3 l4 -> permutation (l1 ++ l3) (l2 ++ l4)
permutation_cons_ex_aux : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l1 l2 -> forall l11 l12 : list A, l1 = l11 ++ a :: l12 -> exists l3 l4 : list A, l2 = l3 ++ a :: l4 /\ permutation (l11 ++ l12) (l3 ++ l4)
Inductive permutation : list A -> list A -> Prop := permutation_nil : permutation [] [] | permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1) | permutation_swap : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), permutation (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l) | permutation_trans : forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> permutation l1 l3 Arguments permutation (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_skip _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments permutation_swap _ _ _%list_scope Arguments permutation_trans (_ _ _)%list_scope
all_permutations_aux_permutation : forall (n : nat) (l1 l2 : list A), n = length l2 -> In l1 (all_permutations_aux l2 n) -> permutation l1 l2
permutation_all_permutations_aux : forall (n : nat) (l1 l2 : list A), n = length l2 -> permutation l1 l2 -> In l1 (all_permutations_aux l2 n)
permutation_app_swap : forall l1 l2 : list A, permutation (l1 ++ l2) (l2 ++ l1)
permutation_cons_ex : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation (a :: l1) l2 -> exists l3 l4 : list A, l2 = l3 ++ a :: l4 /\ permutation l1 (l3 ++ l4)
split_one_in_ex : forall (a : A) (l1 : list A), In a l1 -> exists l2 : list A, In (a, l2) (split_one l1)
permutation_skip : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> permutation (a :: l2) (a :: l1)
permutation_inv : forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation (a :: l1) (a :: l2) -> permutation l1 l2
in_permutation_ex : forall (a : A) (l : list A), In a l -> exists l1 : list A, permutation (a :: l1) l
Znumtheory.Zdivide_dec : forall a b : BinNums.Z, {BinInt.Z.divide a b} + {~ BinInt.Z.divide a b}
Znumtheory.rel_prime_dec : forall a b : BinNums.Z, {Znumtheory.rel_prime a b} + {~ Znumtheory.rel_prime a b}
in_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (a : A) (l : list A), {In a l} + {~ In a l}
permutation_transposition : forall (a b : A) (l1 l2 l3 : list A), permutation (l1 ++ a :: l2 ++ b :: l3) (l1 ++ b :: l2 ++ a :: l3)
Forall_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {Forall P l} + {~ Forall P l}
sumbool_sind : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> SProp), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s

```coq
intros Hdec l1 l2.
induction l1 as [|a l1'].
- induction l2 as [|b l2'].
  + left. constructor.
  + right. intro H. inversion H.
- induction l2 as [|b l2'].
  + right. intro H. inversion H.
  + destruct (Hdec a b) as [Heq|Hneq].
    * rewrite Heq. left. constructor. assumption.
    * right. intro H. inversion H. subst. apply Hneq. reflexivity.
Qed.```

original: intros Hdec l1 l2. induction l1 as [|a l1']. - induction l2 as [|b l2']. + left. constructor. + right. intro H. inversion H. - induction l2 as [|b l2']. + right. intro H. inversion H. + destruct (Hdec a b) as [Heq|Hneq]. * rewrite Heq. left. constructor. auto. * right. intro H. inversion H. subst. apply Hneq. reflexivity.
